{{No skeleton flag}} |resistances=None |vulnerabilities={{Poison vulnerability}} |max_chunks=6 |meat={{Poisonous corpse}} |xp=110 |holiness={{Natural}} |magic_resistance=40 |hp_range=28-61 |avg_hp=44 |armour_class=13 |evasion=4 |habitat=Land |speed= 6 |size={{Large}} |item_use={{Uses nothing}} |attack1=35 ({{Bite type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack2= |attack3= |attack4= |hit_dice=8 |base_hp=3 |extra_hp=5 |fixed_hp=0 |intelligence={{Insect intelligence}} |genus=goliath beetle |species=boring beetle }} {{Flavour|An umber beetle with large, powerful mandibles that enable it to bore through solid rock.}} ==Useful Info== [[Boring beetle]]s are enormous beetles with the ability to burrow through rock [[wall]]s. They are one of the stronger insects in the game, with decent [[AC]] and a heavy attack. However, they are painfully slow and are easy to kite by the time you find them in the deepest parts of [[the Lair]]. ==Tips & Tricks== *Boring beetles make a 'grinding sound' when they dig, alerting you to their presence on the floor. *If boring beetles show up with other enemies, be aware that they can dig around other creatures to get at you if you try to retreat into a corridor. *A fleeing boring beetle will always run away from you, including through walls. *Boring beetles may appear guarding a Pet Rocks [[shop]] along with [[earth elemental]]s or some of the lesser [[List of golems|golems]]. These shops might appear before your character is strong enough to deal with the enemies inside, so use caution if you see one. ==History== Boring beetles were removed for being boring in [[0.17]].
